item.title: 全球股票基金连续第六周吸引资金流入
item.description: 截至 7 月 31 日，全球投资者连续第六周保持股票基金净买入，原因是市场预期美国联邦储备委员会最早将在 9 月份发出降息信号，这可能会降低企业借贷成本。【原文：Global investors remained net buyers of equity funds for a sixth successive week through July 31, driven by expectations that the U.S. Federal Reserve would signal a rate cut as early as September, which could reduce corporate borrowing costs.】

item.title: VIEW 美国就业人数疲软为美联储9月减息敞开大门
item.description: 美国 7 月份的就业增长放缓幅度超过预期，失业率上升至 4.3%，这可能加剧人们对劳动力市场正在恶化的担忧，并可能使经济容易陷入衰退。【原文：U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in July, while the unemployment rate increased to 4.3%, which could heighten fears that the labor market is deteriorating and potentially making the economy vulnerable to a recession.】

item.title: 就业数据疲软，美联储 9 月将降息半点
item.description: 周五，交易商押注美联储将在9月份开始放松政策，大幅降息半个百分点，此前政府数据显示，上个月雇主增加的工人数量远低于预期，失业率上升。 利率期货合约目前反映出，下个月降息半个百分点的可能性约为 70%，而《纽约时报》之前的预测为 70%。【原文：Traders bet on Friday that the Federal Reserve will start easing policy in September with a big half-percentage-point interest rate cut, after government data showed employers added far fewer workers than expected last month, and the jobless rate rose. Interest rate futures contracts now reflect about a 70% chance seen of a half-percentage-point rate cut next month, versus what was seen before the】

item.title: 美国 7 月就业增长不及预期；失业率升至 4.3
item.description: 美国 7 月份的就业增长放缓幅度超过预期，失业率上升至 4.3%，这可能加剧人们对劳动力市场正在恶化的担忧，并可能使经济容易陷入衰退。【原文：U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in July, while the unemployment rate increased to 4.3%, which could heighten fears that the labor market is deteriorating and potentially making the economy vulnerable to a recession.】

item.title: 前景黯淡加剧广告竞争担忧，Snap 股价暴跌
item.description: Snap 母公司 Snapchat 的低迷预测加剧了华尔街的担忧，即在广告领域的激烈竞争中，该公司将继续把业务拱手让给更大的竞争对手。【原文：Shares of Snap slumped 17% premarket on Friday, after a dour forecast from the Snapchat parent reinforced Wall Street's worries that the company would continue to cede business to bigger rivals amid intense competition in the advertising space.】

item.title: 23andMe 拒绝 CEO Wojcicki 提出的私有化要约
item.description: 23andMe 周五表示，不会接受首席执行官安妮-沃西基（Anne Wojcicki）的私有化提议，并要求她撤回反对任何替代交易的计划。【原文：23andMe said on Friday that it will not go ahead with CEO Anne Wojcicki's take-private offer and has asked her to withdraw any plan to oppose any alternative deal.】

item.title: 利安德巴塞尔（LyondellBasell）季度利润超出预期，利润率有望改善
item.description: 石油化工制造商利安德巴塞尔（LyondellBasell）周五公布的第二季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，并表示预计第三季度利润率将继续受益于较低的原料价格。【原文：Petrochemical manufacturer LyondellBasell on Friday edged past Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit and said it expects margins to continue to benefit from lower feedstock prices in the third quarter.】

item.title: 安全套生产商 Church & Dwight 因消费者转趋谨慎而下调财年预期
item.description: Church & Dwight 周五表示，由于消费者对其价格较高的家用和个人护理产品的消费犹豫不决，该公司预计全年销售额和利润将低于此前的预期。【原文：Church & Dwight said on Friday it expects full-year sales and profit at the lower end of its previous forecast due to consumer hesitancy on spending for its higher-priced household and personal care products.】

item.title: 投资者推动对冲活动增加，Cboe 盈利超出预期
item.description: Cboe Global Markets 周五公布的第二季度利润高于预期，主要得益于地缘政治紧张局势和利率上升促使投资者积极对冲风险，期权交易增长强劲。【原文：Cboe Global Markets reported a higher-than-expected second-quarter profit on Friday, helped by strong growth in options trading as geopolitical tensions and elevated interest rates prompted investors to actively hedge their exposure.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚第二季度盈利 92 亿美元，上调产量目标
item.description: 埃克森美孚周五公布的第二季度利润为 92 亿美元，好于预期，原因是今年收购页岩油公司先锋自然资源公司（Pioneer Natural Resources）后产量增加。【原文：Exxon Mobil on Friday posted a better-than-expected $9.2 billion second-quarter profit based on rising output from its purchase this year of shale oil firm Pioneer Natural Resources.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙就下一任美国总统发表看法，但不支持任何人
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）列出了他希望下一任美国总统应具备的领导能力清单，但并没有为候选人背书。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has outlined his wish list of leadership skills that the next U.S. president should possess, but stopped short of endorsing a candidate.】

item.title: 雪佛龙第二季度盈利不及预期，炼油利润率疲软
item.description: 受炼油利润率疲软的影响，石油巨头雪佛龙公司周五公布的第二季度利润低于预期，导致其股价在盘前交易中下跌 1.5%。【原文：Oil giant Chevron Corp missed estimates for second-quarter profit on Friday, hurt by weak refining margins, sending its shares down 1.5% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 在七月故障前减持 Crowdstrike 股份
item.description: 据周五提交的一份监管文件显示，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 削减了其在网络安全公司 Crowdstrike 的股份。【原文：Google-parent Alphabet cut its stake in cybersecurity company Crowdstrike , according to a regulatory filing on Friday, much before the July 19 outage triggered by a software update.】

item.title: 早间竞购反思经济衰退风险与人工智能，市场惶恐不安
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: UPS 提高假期利润的计划可能会让托运人望而却步
item.description: 全球最大的包裹快递公司 UPS 是行业内第一个宣布今年假期附加费的主要企业，它公布的大幅涨价可能会适得其反。【原文：UPS, the world's biggest package delivery courier, is the first major industry player to announce this year's holiday surcharges, unveiling hefty hikes that analysts say could backfire.】

item.title: 美联储迫在眉睫的降息幅度可能取决于就业市场
item.description: 对金融市场来说，美联储预期的宽松政策的关键问题越来越多地围绕着降息的规模，而不是降息的时机。【原文：For financial markets, the key question hanging over the Federal Reserve's expected policy easing increasingly revolves around the size of interest rate cuts and less on their timing.】

item.title: NHTSA 对近 100 万辆斯泰兰特道奇 SUV 进行工程分析
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五将其对近 100 万辆斯泰兰特道奇品牌汽车的调查从对门锁和车窗故障的初步评估升级为工程分析。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Friday upgraded its investigation into nearly 1 million Stellantis' Dodge brand vehicles to an engineering analysis from a preliminary evaluation over faulty door locks and windows.】

item.title: 亚马逊和英特尔业绩预测令人失望，期指下滑；就业数据令人期待
item.description: 在亚马逊和英特尔公司发布负面预测后，美国股指期货周五大幅下跌，投资者正在等待一份至关重要的就业报告，以进一步了解劳动力市场的线索，因为对经济放缓的担忧挥之不去。【原文：U.S. index futures fell sharply on Friday following downbeat forecasts from Amazon and Intel, with investors awaiting a crucial jobs report for further clues on the labor market amid lingering concerns over an economic slowdown.】

item.title: 亚马逊发出警告后，沃尔玛的低价承诺成为焦点
item.description: 沃尔玛的 "天天低价 "承诺将在其季度业绩报告中接受考验。此前，竞争对手亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）警告称，顾客已经变成了讨价还价的猎手，迫使这家网上购物巨头预测本季度业绩疲软。【原文：Walmart's "Everyday Low Price" promise will be put to the test when it reports quarterly results, after rival Amazon.com's warning that customers had turned bargain hunters, pressuring the online shopping behemoth to forecast a weak current quarter.】

item.title: 特斯拉 7 月在华电动车销量同比增长 15.3
item.description: 中国乘用车联席会（CPCA）周五公布的数据显示，7月份美国汽车制造商特斯拉在中国生产的电动汽车销量同比增长15.3%，达到74,117辆。【原文：U.S. automaker Tesla's sales of China-made electric vehicles rose 15.3% from a year earlier to 74,117 units in July, data from the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) showed on Friday.】

item.title: 英特尔扭亏为盈，股价将创 24 年来最大跌幅
item.description: 英特尔暂停派息并裁员，以资助其芯片制造业务进行代价高昂的扭亏为盈，这将是该公司自 2000 年以来最严重的一次抛售，周五英特尔的市值将被抹去近 250 亿美元。【原文：Intel was set to erase nearly $25 billion in market value on Friday in what would be its worst selloff since 2000 after it suspended its dividend and slashed its workforce to fund a costly turnaround for its chip-making business.】

item.title: 全国企业数据库显示，特斯拉在中国注册了保险经纪公司
item.description: 根据国家企业信息数据库，特斯拉于 7 月底在中国注册了一家保险经纪公司，这表明这家美国汽车制造商可能正在再次尝试获得在中国销售保险产品的批准。【原文：Tesla registered an insurance broking firm in China at the end of July, based on a national corporate information database, in a sign that the U.S. automaker may be trying again to gain approval to sell insurance products in the country.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司七月份销量增长 6
item.description: 总部位于瑞典的沃尔沃汽车公司周五表示，受欧洲全电动汽车销量增长的推动，该公司 7 月份的汽车销量同比增长 6%，达到 57,447 辆。【原文：Volvo Cars' sales rose 6% year-on-year in July to 57,447 cars, driven by an increase in fully electric vehicles in Europe, the Sweden-based automaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 印尼财政部预计第二季度国内生产总值增长 5%，并强调地缘政治风险
item.description: 印尼财政部长周五表示，印尼第二季度经济增长可能略微放缓至5%，当局正在关注可能影响国内经济的地缘政治发展。【原文：Indonesia's economic growth probably slowed slightly to 5% in the second quarter and authorities are monitoring geopolitical developments that could affect the domestic economy, its finance minister said on Friday.】

item.title: 媒体报道美国调查后，英伟达股价在法兰克福下跌 2
item.description: 据媒体报道，在接到竞争对手芯片制造商的投诉后，美国政府将对英伟达展开反垄断调查，与此同时，科技股也出现了大面积抛售，英伟达股价周五在法兰克福下跌了 2.3%。【原文：Nvidia shares fell 2.3% in Frankfurt on Friday, following media reports of the U.S. government launching an antitrust probe into the company following complaints from rival chipmakers, and alongside a broad sell off in tech stocks.】

item.title: 亚马逊股价在法兰克福暴跌近 8
item.description: 亚马逊周五在法兰克福早盘交易中股价下跌近8%，此前亚马逊公布第二季度在线销售增长放缓，并指出消费者正在寻找更便宜的购物选择。【原文：Amazon shares fell almost 8% in early trading in Frankfurt on Friday after reporting slowing online sales growth in the second quarter and noting consumers were seeking out cheaper options for purchases.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，奥迪全新中国电动车系列将不会采用标志性的四环标志
item.description: 两位直接了解该计划的人士表示，奥迪在中国为中国市场开发的新电动汽车系列将不会使用其四环标志。【原文：Audi's new electric cars series developed in China for the Chinese market will not sport its four-ring logo, two people with direct knowledge of the plans said.】

item.title: 中国央行顾问呼吁加大刺激力度，实现通胀目标
item.description: 一位央行政策顾问在上周五的讲话中表示，中国应加大财政刺激力度以刺激经济增长，并设定一个坚定的通胀目标，以防止中国陷入 "低通胀陷阱"。【原文：China should ramp up its fiscal stimulus to spur economic growth and set a firm inflation target to prevent the country falling into a "low inflation trap", a central bank policy adviser said in remarks seen on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 日益加剧的经济忧虑威胁美股涨势
item.description: 经济忧虑再次出现在华尔街的雷达上，因为人们越来越担心，数月来的高利率可能开始损害美国的经济增长。【原文：Economic concerns are once again showing up on Wall Street's radar, as worries grow that months of elevated interest rates may be starting to hurt U.S. growth.】

item.title: 早间竞标对经济增长的新担忧令市场恐慌
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】
